body.p: 1. Toi’s son and king of Hamath. He was sent by Toi to offer congratulations to David when David won a victory over Hadadezer of Zobah (2 Sm 8:9-12). He is also called Hadoram in 1 Chronicles 18:10.
2. Alternate name for Jehoram, king of Judah (853–841 BC). See Jehoram #1.
3. Alternate name for Jehoram, king of Israel (852–841 BC). See Jehoram #2.
4. Jeshaiah’s son from Levi’s tribe (1 Chr 26:25).
